item.title: Max stat 200
item.dc:creator: @buddy863 buddy863
item.description:
@buddy863 wrote:

Seach

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {

Until you see this

[code]public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 135; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 135;[/code]

Then change the 300 to 400 and the 135 (or whatever it may be) to 200

[code]public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 200; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 400.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 200;[/code]

Once your done with that search

int Runecrafting = getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]);

You should see this

int Runecrafting = getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]); if ((amount + playerXP[skill]) < 135 || playerXP[skill] > 2000000000) { sendMessage("Max XP value reached"); return false; }
Change the 135 (it may be different) to 200

int Runecrafting = getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]); if ((amount + playerXP[skill]) < 200 || playerXP[skill] > 2000000000) { sendMessage("Max XP value reached"); return false; }
There ya go.

Read full topic

item.title: Max stat 200
item.dc:creator: @Slivion Slivion
item.description:
@Slivion wrote:

I can help,

Open up Client Java,
Hold Ctrl and F,
Search,

995000000

You should see,

if ((amount + playerXP[skill]) < 0 || playerXP[skill] > 995000000) {

Change the,

995000000

To the amount of Experience at level 253.
